intro: Mapouria alba var. tristis, commonly known as the white mapouria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually oval in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
